Description: Body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery column-krater; interior glazed black; exterior: black-figure komast scene; lower body of komast remaining, dancing to left; short added red chiton; right leg raised, possibly part of his lowered left hand on right; at left, fingers of both hands of another komast.
Curator's comments: The bottom of the chiton is not delineated by incised lines. There is an unusual median line on the torso.
Bibliographic references: Vase / Catalogue of Vases in the British Museum (B103.21.1)
Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 228, no. 20)
Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 263-4, no. B187)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0125) (Phase 1)
Alexandridou 2011 / The Early Black-Figured Pottery of Attika in Context (c. 630-570BCE) (p. 123) (Naukratis 103)
